trans-unit.source: Represents a security token that is based upon a user name and password.
Use UserNameSecurityToken class to provide authentication credentials in the form of a user name and password.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken"></xref> class using the specified user name and password.
A user name.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.UserName*> property.
A password for the user name.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.Password*> property.
userName is .
-or- password is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken"></xref> class using the specified user name, password, and unique identifier.
A user name.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.UserName*> property.
A password for the user name.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.Password*> property.
A unique identifier of the security token.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.Id*> property.
userName is .
-or- password is .
-or- id is .
Gets a unique identifier of the security token.
The Id property is usually in the format of a URI with a GUID.
A unique identifier of the security token.
Gets the password for the user name associated with the security token.
The password for the user name associated with the security token.
Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken> security tokens cannot be used for cryptographic operations, by default, so the SecurityKeys property returns an empty collection.
A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey"></xref> that contains the set of keys associated with the security token.
Gets the user name that is associated with the security token.
The user name that is associated with the security token.
Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.

Use the ValidFrom and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties to determine the time period in which a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken> token is valid.
The ValidFrom and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.
Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and ValidTo properties to determine the time period in which a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken> token is valid.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and ValidTo properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
